Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2012 10:03AM jen_b wrote: I've been taking Femara since January and have felt great. For me Femara is much better than Tamoxifen, no heavy head and less depression bouts. I do experience stiff joints every morning or if I sit too long in the same place, but can overcome this with a hot shower, cup of tea and exercise. It's best to push through the fatigue with exercise. Just a 15 -20 minute walk does the trick or just keep moving. I find the stiff joints change from week to week. It's very strange sometimes it's my feet and hands or hips and shoulders or my lower back. As I said I'm feeling great most of the time. I work full time and lead a normal life. Thank you, Femara, Xgeva and Zoladex!

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2011 12:09AM jen_b wrote: Hi CoolBreeze, I too am travelling your road. I was diagnosed with stage 4 only three weeks after my initial diagnosis. It's a bummer! I too have only 2 small liver mets and hope that they can be blasted. I haven't had any chemo or rads only hormone therapy. I feel your pain, but I know it's a waste of time to draw on the negatives. I try to surround myself with POSITIVE VIBES, but sometimes it's hard. I look at my children and my eyes fill with tears sometimes... silly, but true. I plan to be around a LOOOONG time. Those statistics are only that, STATISTICS! Big hug for you, CoolBreeze!
